benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Add tags to payment

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios validate successful creation with valid payloads (TC01, TC02, TC03), including handling of a single element and multiple elements.
Empty Payload Edge: Empty array in body (TC04) is allowed and returns 201 with an empty result, covering empty-input behavior.
Not Found Handling: Non-existent payment (TC05) and empty DB scenario (TC18) verify 404 responses when the payment is missing.

Validation of Path and Payload: Tests for invalid paymentId format (TC06), missing required header (TC07), malformed JSON body (TC08), invalid tag UUID format (TC09), extra/unsupported fields (TC10), and malicious input (TC16) cover input validation extensively.
Idempotency and Deduplication: Duplicate tag UUIDs in input (TC11) and idempotent creation (TC19) ensure duplicates are not created.
Authorization & Security: Unauthorized user (TC15) and security-focused tests (TC16, TC17) cover access control and input security.
Server Availability: Service unavailability scenario (TC13) verifies 503 handling for dependency failure.
Performance/Load Scenarios: Heavy load (TC12) and concurrency (TC20) scenarios test performance and consistency under stress.
Boundary/Maximum Payload: Maximum allowed number of tag definitions (TC14) tests boundary conditions.
Response Content Validation: Tests verify the response includes Tag objects with required fields (paymentId, tagDefinitionId, metadata) (TC01, TC03).
gaps: 500 Internal Server Error coverage:Tests do not explicitly cover 500 Internal Server Error scenarios (only 503 in TC13).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No explicit tests dedicated to rate limiting or throttling behavior.
Caching/ETag: No tests checking caching headers or ETag on POST responses.
405/Unsupported Method: No tests asserting behavior for invalid HTTP methods (e.g., PUT/GET on this POST endpoint).
recommendations: Add a 500 Internal Server Error test to cover database or service-layer failures (beyond 503).
Introduce rate-limiting tests to validate behavior under bursty traffic and ensure proper throttling or retries.
Add caching behavior tests (ETag/Cache-Control) for POST responses where applicable, to validate caching semantics.
Include a test asserting proper handling of unsupported HTTP methods (e.g., 405 Method Not Allowed) for this endpoint.
